speaker: Family Vault
lines: Marble biers shoulder one another like brothers who outlived the will.
A ledger sits open on a stand; every name is written twice, once in ink, once in salt.
Portraits painted on copper plates stare from their patina fog.
A single ring lies on the floor, too warm to be left long.
In the far corner, a veil of air sags inward as if gravity forgot itself.
The veil quivers when you breathe. It quivers when you try not to.
Somewhere between pages, blood once dried with care.
Between breaths, something remembers it was not finished.

choices.text: Face what stirs between the pages.
Read the ledger aloud, name by name.
Seal the door with salt and withdraw.
